title: ✦ 2026 — A Year of Intention ✦
contentText:
## ✦ 2026 — A Year of Intention ✦

*January, 2026*

**By Feben Getachew**

---

### ✧ Opening My Journal ✧

Today, I begin.
Not because everything is clear,
but because my heart desires to live **intentionally**.

I want to be careful with my life —
with what I do,
with what I think,
with what I allow to shape my mind.

Time moves fast,
and I do not want my brain to serve only what time throws at it.
I want to **think deeply**,
to pause,
to reflect,
to choose my path with wisdom.

So in this new year, **2026**,
I open this journal for myself —
and before God.

---

### ✧ Who I Am ✧

My name is **Feben Getachew**.
I am 22 years old.
I am a Christian woman,
a university student studying **Software Engineering**.

I love art — especially **painting**.
I love ideas, old styles, deep thoughts.
I am a little overthinker,
but I believe God can use even that.

I love my parents deeply.
I am very attached to my father and mother.
I have brothers and sisters,
and I am the youngest —
the smallest one at home,
yet deeply loved.

I love books, theology, and quiet moments.
I desire a future that honors God —
a marriage built on the Bible,
children raised with love and truth,
a home filled with canvas, colors, and books.

Above all,
I want to **know God daily**
through prayer
and through His Word.

---

### ✧ My Intention for 2026 ✧

This year, I choose **intention** over noise.

I want to live on purpose.
I want to use what **God has placed inside me**.

---

### ✧ Art — Returning to My First Love ✧

This year, I return to **painting**.

There was a Christmas night —
a Friday —
where my brush and I met again
after almost a year apart.

No practice.
Little time.
Yet we stood on the stage together.

It was not perfect,
but it was alive.

Midnight drawings followed.
And something inside me woke up.

When I draw,
when I see colors,
I feel like I am **floating**.
My heart sings quietly.

So in 2026,
I will draw.
I will practice.
I will grow.

Not for perfection —
but for joy
and faithfulness.

---

### ✧ Reading — Returning to Books ✧

Once, books were my close friends.
In elementary school and high school,
I loved fiction and stories.

Then university came.
Computers replaced pages.
Coding replaced reading.

But this year,
I return.

In 2026, I plan to read **at least 10 books**:

* Spiritual and theological books
* Fiction
* History
* Psychology

I believe books will shape my mind,
soften my heart,
and prepare me for life after graduation.

---

### ✧ Growth and Responsibility ✧

I have **one and a half years** left at university.
Time is precious.

In two months,
I will be an intern,
with no classes.

I want to use that time wisely.

My plan:

* To grow my **software development skills**
* To earn a **constant income**, no matter how small
* To prepare myself for life after graduation

I also dream of starting a **small business**.
I am still praying and thinking about what it will be.
I trust God will guide me.

---

### ✧ Service — Loving Others for Christ ✧

I am a leader at **5 Kilo Christian Students Fellowship**.

This year, I want to serve more.
I want to:

* Help students love God deeply
* Bring them closer to Jesus
* Encourage Bible study
* Support them in whatever they need

I want my leadership to be gentle, faithful, and full of love.

---

### ✧ A Prayer for This Year ✧

God,
walk with me in every step I take.

Guide my thoughts.
Bless my work.
Grow my gifts.
Protect my heart.

Let my life glorify You —
in art,
in study,
in service,
and in quiet moments.

**Be with me in 2026.
Always.**

✝️︎ Amen ✝️︎
